result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshazo A Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges, be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any remaining amount due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC;  dated February 27, 2015/Judge M.Joseph Donald/the defendant is statutorily excluded from participating in the CIP & WSAPprograms under Chapter940.Stats.***
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case #14CF3866 and to any other sentence defendant is currently serving, credit for 60 days time served.
**5/28/2015  credit amended to 194 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Obtain a GED or HSED.

No use of any weapons. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
Complete an anger management counseling program.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Additional Sentence Credit signed and filed. Copies mailed to parties.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.
Per Order signed on May 28, 2015:  credit amended to 194 days.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction in 14CF001238 shall be amended to include a total of 194 days of sentence credit.  The judgment of conviction in 14CF003866 shall be amended to include a total of 137 days of sentence credit.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit in cases 14CF001238 and 14CF003866.
Amending Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify defendant's eligibility for early release programs due to his conviction under Ch. 940, Stats.
Original Transcript (35 pages) commencing Sentencing Hearing 01/12/2015. Receieved and Filed.

Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant withdrew his letter requesting to withdraw his plea.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 54 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS, concurrent to case# 14CF3866, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Credit for 60 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Complete an anger management counseling program.
* Obtain a GED or HSED.
* No use of any weapons.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS: 
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.  Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have now reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court CONVERTED the 01-12-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date to a Sentencing Hearing date.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.

Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury trial dates.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 12-10-2014 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 01-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Court set bail at $1,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services with GPS monitoring (24-hour curfew).  Conditions of bail release:  (1) No possession of any weapons.  (2) Submit to drug screens.

Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a bench warrant return today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Atty. Klimetz advised the court that the defendant is no longer able to afford the private retainer.
Atty. Klimetz moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Klimetz to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
**Atty. Frederick Klimetz is now discharged.
Atty. Klimetz to ensure new counsel is appointed by 09-19-2014.

Defendant recently picked up new charges.
Case adjourned to 09-23-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Return on Warrant Hearing.

Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Deshazo A Campbell in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kevin Tyler-MCSD Corrections Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
